item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: True... I just wish there were a more accurate way to measure it (aka like experience bars to leveling up on an RPG). Haha.
item.content:encoded: True… I just wish there were a more accurate way to measure it (aka like experience bars to leveling up on an RPG). Haha.

item.title: By: afterbreak
item.dc:creator: afterbreak
item.description: well, thats only half true with rank/rating wise =) I can say only something similar to old japanase saying bout learining joseki. When you learn joseki, u became weaker 5 stones, but when You understand it You gain 6 stones :P so its like +1 in rank, but not sure how much of truth it is. When I was weaker - I learned only some basic josekis, most peacefull ones, and thats it. At this point I can say, for us SDK and some low dans players learing them is a waste of time, study maybe ok, but doing life and death problems and tesuji ones too is more important, that way You learn most of josekis.
item.content:encoded:
well, thats only half true with rank/rating wise =)
I can say only something similar to old japanase saying bout learining joseki. When you learn joseki, u became weaker 5 stones, but when You understand it You gain 6 stones ðŸ˜› so its like +1 in rank, but not sure how much of truth it is.
When I was weaker – I learned only some basic josekis, most peacefull ones, and thats it. At this point I can say, for us SDK and some low dans players learing them is a waste of time, study maybe ok, but doing life and death problems and tesuji ones too is more important, that way You learn most of josekis.

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: There's actually an easy way to tell if your reading is getting better. You kill more, die less, and getting stronger (rank/rating wise). =)
item.content:encoded: There’s actually an easy way to tell if your reading is getting better. You kill more, die less, and getting stronger (rank/rating wise). =)

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Now it's just a matter of finding a way to consistently improve at my reading. It's sometimes difficult to gauge whether or not I'm getting any better or if my methodology is working. Haha.
item.content:encoded: Now it’s just a matter of finding a way to consistently improve at my reading. It’s sometimes difficult to gauge whether or not I’m getting any better or if my methodology is working. Haha.
